poem:
**Passing Conversations**

In the small morning quiet,
echoes of father to son,
Vic Metcalfe's swift feet,
Jimmy Glazzard's echoing name.
Huddersfield breathes
in every shared silence,
each story spun—
a ball kicked through generations,
lingering in the grass
where roots and memories meet.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "My dad, Munich and the Busby Babes: United in grief As with a lot of fathers and sons, I suspect, probably 50% or more of the conversations my father and I had were about sport, and most of them were about football. Like my grandfather, like myself, my father was a lifelong supporter of Huddersfield Town, and he often talked about the great Town sides and players of the past: Vic Metcalfe and Jimmy Glazzard,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
